_comment: Created by ianb on 29/05/2014 15:06:10 using v2.1
title: How does the rate of NHS knee replacement operation vary by deprivation?
analysis_commentary: The chart shows the directly standardised rate of elective knee replacements per 100,000 population, adjusted for sex and age, by IMD deprivation decile. The data is shown for 2012/13 and excludes private treatment. Here the results are different to those observed for hip replacements, with lower knee replacement rates observed in the higher socioeconomic groups. Lower treatment rates in the less deprived areas could be associated with a greater uptake of privately funded treatment.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Hospital Episode Statistics
